WorkItem.Description: I downloaded Silverlight from the link on the EJ page and then restarted the browser, but I can't get the Rawr GUI to load.  I get the Silverlight progress indicator, but it gets to 100% and never goes beyond that.  I searched the issue tracker and tried the suggested fixes for anything related I could find, ie clearing cache etc, but none have been successful.  I've tried Firefox, IE , and Chrome (on Windows XP), but no luck.  I've never used Silverlight, so I'm not sure what to troubleshoot beyond what I could find in the tracker.  Any suggestions are appreciated.

Comments.Message: Fully uninstall all versions of Silverlight, then install the latest version by going to silverlight.net.

As far as I can tell, Rawr3 uses ElitistArmory for character information.  But I believe that site was taken down by the creator so that he could use the server for other projects.  I have been unable to access ElitistArmory.com since about 9/6 and since that same time Raw3 will not load my characters from the Armory.
Slowkill, that has nothing to do with this issue.

Webpage error details

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/4.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; Media Center PC 6.0; .NET4.0C)
Timestamp: Tue, 14 Sep 2010 13:53:01 UTC


Message: Unhandled Error in Rawr 
Code: 2007    
Category: ParserError       
Message: 2007 An error has occurred.     
File:      
Line: 8     
Position: 45     

Line: 35
Char: 13
Code: 0
URI: http://elitistjerks.com/rawr.php

Everyone automatically assumes that your install is wrong, really don't understand that. But anyway problem still exists.

The assumption that the problem is with the Silverlight install is due to it working without problems on many other setups.
When I try this on my work comp with an old Silverlight version I get the described, but on my comp at home it works without any problem.
Sorry about that the last line, "Everyone......" is a signature line, forgot to delete it. I discovered the problem however, it was with my 64bit browser. Working now
Have exactly the same issue. Trying IE, IE-64bit, Firefox, Chrome - all stuck at loading "100%". Tried on two computers with equal results. On both running system is win7x64.
Tried to clear browser cashe, tried to clear application storage - no result.
Tried to reinstall silverlight - no result.
Problem fixed by upgrading silverlight vertion to latest 4.xx
